{{disambig-two: }}'''Adrahil II''' was the twenty-first [[Princes of Dol Amroth
Adrahil was the son of [[Angelimir]]. He became the twenty-first Prince of Dol Amroth after his father's death in {{TA
Adrahil had three children. The eldest was a daughter, [[Ivriniel]]. His second daughter, [[Finduilas (wife of Denethor)
Prince of [[Dor-en-Ernil]]: Denethor II]] and was the mother of [[Boromir]] and [[Faramir]]. Adrahil's only son and heir was [[Imrahil]].
Elendil}}, ''The Line of Dol Amroth'', p. 221</ref>

{{disambig-two: Adrahil presumably is an [[Adûnaic]] name of unknown meaning.

The second element ''-hil'' (also seen in the name ''[[Imrahil]]'') perhaps is related to the [[Westron]] ending ''-kil'' (cf. ''[[banakil]], [[Tarkil]]'') meaning "man", ultimately related to [[Elvish]] "follower".<ref>[[Carl F. Hostetter]], [[Patrick Wynne]], "An Adunaic Dictionary", published in ''[[Vinyar Tengwar 25]]'' (September [[1992]])</ref>
